title: Gnudi

herbs: 6–7 fresh sage leaves or 1 tsp dried sage

steps: Boil spinach in salted water. Drain, cool, and squeeze out excess water. Chop finely.
Let ricotta drain for at least 30 minutes.
Sauté spinach: cook spinach with olive oil, salt, pepper, and optional garlic for 3–4 minutes. Cool.
Combine cooled spinach with ricotta, Parmesan, nutmeg, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Add egg and flour. Mix thoroughly.
Form mixture into balls using slightly damp hands. Roll in flour to coat.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook gnudi until they rise to the top.
Slowly melt butter in a pan with sage. Add the gnudi to the sauce and gently sauté. Serve immediately.
